com.healtcare

Class SMSUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.healtcare.SMSUtil
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SmsUtilImpl

    public abstract class SMSUtil
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class is an abstract class to send and receive text SMS with a GSM Modem. It uses Sun's Java Communication API for windows. It can be, however, migrated to Rx-Tx, too. This is a simple API, which works with many tested devices like Smasung SGH-B520 etc., which cost very little as compared to other trendy handsets. You can use this API with J2SE 1.4 and above.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SMSUtil(java.lang.String strPortName)
      This is the constructor that takes as argument the name of the COM Port where the GSM device is connected to.

      • SMSUtil

        public SMSUtil(java.lang.String strPortName)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        This is the constructor that takes as argument the name of the COM Port where the GSM device is connected to. If the port is owned by another application or does not exist, Exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • startReceive

        public final void startReceive(java.util.ArrayList alSMSStore,
                int intDelay)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        This method starts receiving a message in a separate thread. The arguments are an ArrayList where the Sender's number and message text are Stored in a String[] as element, and an int delay that the program waits for before checking an SMS
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • processSMS

        public abstract void processSMS(java.lang.String strPhNo,
              java.lang.String strMsg)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is abstract and must be defined in the subclass so as to customize the action to be taken on receiving an SMS It takes Phone No. and Message Text Received as argument in form of String both, for further customization
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getCurrentMsgIndex

        public abstract int getCurrentMsgIndex()
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is abstract and must be defined in the sub class so as to tell the program where to start from while reading the SMS. If you want to continuously receive SMS, then you should ideally provide the code in this method definition to store the index of last saved index of the SMS in a database table for future. Even if the machine is turned off, the GSM device will receive message(s) and when the PC is turned on again, it'd just process all the new SMS. You should also update the msg index in the database table accordingly after having processed an SMS
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
